text:
No Escape from the Past

Dark room, tense atmosphere, two men facing off.  
Raskolnikov: “No!”  
Svidrigaïlov: “I thought I did. You’re ‘the man.’”  

---  

Same room, silence thickens, confusion hangs.  
Raskolnikov: “What do you mean?”  
Svidrigaïlov: “I really don’t know…”  

---  

Raskolnikov, agitated, leans forward, eyes wide.  
Raskolnikov: “That’s nonsense! What does she say?”  
Svidrigaïlov: “Silliest trifles! It makes me angry.”  

---  

Flashback to Svidrigaïlov’s study, a clock ticking.  
Svidrigaïlov: “You forgot to wind the clock.”  
Svidrigaïlov: “I ran away in fright!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Svidrigaïlov describes his encounters with the ghost of his deceased wife, Marfa Petrovna, who engages him in trivial conversations.
